holidays.name: Inspire Your Heart with Art Day
holidays.description: A day to appreciate all forms of art and let creativity warm your soul.
holidays.origin: Started by the nonprofit organization Customs House in Australia to encourage people to reflect on the impact of art in our lives.
holidays.funFact: This day was created in 2004 and pushes people to visit galleries or create their own art for emotional inspiration.

holidays.name: Hot Chocolate Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the cozy, chocolaty goodness of hot chocolate to beat the January chill.
holidays.origin: An informal food holiday celebrated mainly in the U.S. during the cold winter months to enjoy this soothing drink.
holidays.funFact: The Aztecs were among the first to drink a chilly version of hot chocolate, often spiced up with chili peppers!

holidays.name: Backwards Day
holidays.description: A quirky observance where people do things backward ‚Äî wear clothes inside out, say goodbye instead of hello, or walk backward!
holidays.origin: Created in 1998 by a man named Clarence Shulock to bring silliness and fun to everyday life.
holidays.funFact: Some schools participate by having students write backward or speak in reverse sentences on this day.

holidays.name: Blame Someone Else Day
holidays.description: A tongue-in-cheek holiday encouraging people to pass the blame and have a laugh instead of stressing out about mistakes.
holidays.origin: Invented in 1982 by Dale and Laura Dowling after the January blues as a humorous way to shift responsibility temporarily.
holidays.funFact: This day is unofficial but beloved by pranksters and office workers everywhere looking for a lighthearted excuse.
